I wondered the same about the music - turns out the files contain -three- separate audio tracks

- Original Japanes
- English with Original Japanese music (default)
- English with the far better Bruce Falconer (Funimation) Music

So you need to figure out how to switch the audio stream in whatever player your using.
I'm using Zoom Player and it's just a matter of right-click -> stream selection -> select English [Funimation]

and btw how fricken awesome is it that such great picture and audio quality, together with -three- audio tracks can be packaged into such small files. My hat's off to whoever sorted us out with this torrent.
Cheers mate.

First of all, i would like to thank the uploader with the deepest part of my heart, to give me the entire Dragon ball z anime in such small files, having 3 audio streams. I looked up other torrents, they had 58 gb, 99gb sizes. Woah, it would take my slow net 3 days to download just one episode from those. This torrent solves everything.
I dont know how you did it, whether you ripped it with some godly technique, or just directly uploaded Funimations remastered release of all seasons, but nevertheless, its outstanding.
To people who are skeptical about the small size, dont be. One word about the quality - ' greater than axxo'. Three words actually.
Its unbelievable, each episode just 50mb, having 3 audio streams, and such awesome quality. Its ever better than some other torrent, which has 280 mb size of each episode. How can someone do that?!?!?!
This torrent should seeded till eternity. 
I cant thank you enough.

Now about the torrent:-
It has 3 audio streams
1. Funimation dub - japanese music (default)
2. Funimation dub - funimation music.
3. Japanese dub - Japanese music.
Of all the three, the 2nd audio stream is the best,  which was all i needed, others are bad, around 96kbps only.
I use vlc, its the best player, free, downloaded it through google. Play the file,
right click on the player window -> audio -> audio tracks-> choose.
Enjoy the variety. I dont know how to make the 2nd stream as default, or change audio streams in other players, but why use other players if you have vlc?!?!?!

I remember seeing the english dub around  5 to 6 years ago. Its not the same dub in this torrent.
I did some research (i.e. i looked up wikipedia)
What i got was this:-
Originally, when english dubbing was started in the 1990s, funimation had hired ocean dub studios to do the dubbing. And that dub was aired in north america and in my country previously, but ocean studios only dubbed around the first 50 episodes, and stopped around the start of the ginyu saga. After which the airing was cancelled due to low ratings.
After few years, the re airing began from where it was left off initially, and this time funimation dubbed the remaining series itself, therefore we had a whole new voice cast and hence different voices. In August 2004, Geneon Entertainment lost its licensing rights to the old Ocean dubbed episodes of Dragon Ball Z, allowing Funimation to re-dub the first 67 episodes, restore the removed content and replace the old voice cast with their in-house one. These re-dubbed episodes aired in the United States on Cartoon Network during the summer of 2005.
This re dubbed part is what we get in this torrent.
I thought the uploader had dubbed the series using his own voice....lol.
All episodes have the funimation dub and music.
So you dont need to go anywhere else, start downloading and seeding this torrent.
Once again my heartiest thanks.

Using mkv files will give lots of problems.
IF you just want to watch the series, its fine
but if you want to make videos, mkv files do not work in any video editor, it pissed me off a lot.
It also cannot be converted properly as it has 3 different audio streams
Suggestion: if you want to make videos, then use fraps software to record the action part in an avi file. and then use that file. Lengthy but works.

But still great quality video
3 audio streams is pointless, all it did was increase the size of the files, and hindered its conversion to any other format

Okay, i know my previous comments have been shitty but this is last and detailed on the problems using mkv and how to overcome them.

Problems -
1. Any basic video converter will not work mainly because of the 3 audio streams. This ruins almost any chance of writing on a dvd or using it in a video editing software like sony vegas............get the idea.

2. At some places, very few places audio is out of synch.(this cant be overcome, ignore this because of the great quality video)

To overcome this:
Download a software known as ultra mkv converter from the pirate bay itself it works.
Use it to convert these mkv files to any format.
Conversion is awesome and excellent. Video quality is retained and time taken is really less.
The problem is with the audio streams,
This may be confusing, youll get it when you use the software
double click on the video in the source video file window, and choose the single audio stream you want. now you can proceed with ease
You may need codecs........so get klite codec pack....google it, its completely free. It will help in easy playback of many video formats and help speed the conversion.
